data.title: Traducciones árabes de fitónimos griegos y sus correspondencias arameas y hebreas
data.abstractNote: Our aim in this article is to study the twenty-one phytonims that appear in an Eastern Arabic version of the Song of Songs. This is a version rendered from a Greek original, with an important number of readings according to the revision of the LXX made by Symmachus, although the Arabic translator used other Greek and Syriac versions. In each entry we provide the reference of the terms used in the Greek text of the LXX, the Hebrew text and the Syrohexaplar version, as well as references to other Aramaic words, cognates or not, and in some cases their possible etymons.
